heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 04 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (186°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.8°C) and outside temperature (down 6.3°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 14250 lux), cloud levels (up 589 m), and pressure (down 12 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 12405 lux) and cloud levels (up 1267 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 589.1m lower than yesterday, 222.2m lower than the past week, 1266.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 767m to a maximum of 3570m, averaging 1263.4m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1485.6m and 2530m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and a mix of sun and clouds. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.
